intro: Balansaea, commonly known as the "false arrowhead," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araliaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plants are characterized by their alternate, simple, and often palmately lobed leaves. They typically produce small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish-white in color. Balansaea species are often cultivated for their ornamental value and can thrive in a variety of soil types with adequate moisture.
